A **cloak of protection** is a type of [magical](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item") [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [cloth](/wiki/Cloth "Cloth") and has a [randomized appearance](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") when unidentified; the default one associated with it is a [tattered cape](/wiki/Tattered_cape "Tattered cape").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Generation

In addition to random generation, the cloak of protection can be sold in general [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and armor shops.

[Aligned priests](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest"), [high priests](/wiki/High_priest "High priest") and the [Arch Priest](/wiki/Arch_Priest "Arch Priest") have a 2⁄21 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a cloak of protection.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") that are not [monks](/wiki/Monk_\(player_monster\) "Monk (player monster)"), including those generated on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), have an effective \~14.83% chance of generating with a cloak of protection as their initial cloak before role-based replacements.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) [Priests](/wiki/Priest_\(player_monster\) "Priest (player monster)") have a 3⁄4 chance of forcing a [robe](/wiki/Robe "Robe") instead, reducing their effective chance to \~3.71%, while [wizards](/wiki/Wizard_\(player_monster\) "Wizard (player monster)") have a 1⁄2 chance of forcing a [cloak of magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance"), reducing their effective chance to \~7.42%.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

## Description

When worn, a cloak of protection provides 3 points of base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and [MC](/wiki/MC "MC")3, and will [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") itself.

## Strategy

The cloak of protection is the only single piece of armor that grants MC3 by itself, making it a strong option for characters without strong [ranged attacks](/wiki/Ranged_attack "Ranged attack") to defend against certain attack effects, such as the [disenchanter](/wiki/Disenchanter "Disenchanter")'s bite attack (but *not* passive disenchantment) and [level drain](/wiki/Level_drain "Level drain") from monsters like the various [wraiths](/wiki/Wraith_\(monster_class\) "Wraith (monster class)") and [vampires](/wiki/Vampire_\(monster_class\) "Vampire (monster class)").

Players that have another source of [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") (usually [gray dragon scale mail](/wiki/Gray_dragon_scale_mail "Gray dragon scale mail")) and can do without a [cloak of displacement](/wiki/Cloak_of_displacement "Cloak of displacement") may consider this cloak a viable choice for their [ascension kits](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit").

### Identification

A cloak of protection is trivial to identify by wearing it once it has been curse-tested, either using a [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") or an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar"). In terms of [price identification](/wiki/Price_identification "Price identification"), both it and the [cloak of displacement](/wiki/Cloak_of_displacement "Cloak of displacement") have a base price of 50[zm](/wiki/Zm "Zm").

## History

The cloak of protection first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

From this version to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"), several other pieces of armor [provided MC3](/wiki/Magic_cancellation_\(3.4.3\) "Magic cancellation (3.4.3)"): the [cloak of magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance") in particular is the preferred source of MC3 for these versions, with its magic resistance providing much more value compared to the cloak of protection's +2 extra base AC - some variants based on NetHack 3.4.3 and earlier versions maintain similar MC values for cloaks and some other armor.

The cloak of protection is the only piece of armor to give MC3 as of [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0") - some variants based on this and later versions may add new items as additional sources of MC3.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") a cloak of protection will produce either an [oilskin cloak](/wiki/Oilskin_cloak "Oilskin cloak") or [elven cloak](/wiki/Elven_cloak "Elven cloak"), while upgrading an oilskin cloak or elven cloak has a 1⁄4 chance of producing a cloak of protection.

### SporkHack

In [Sporkhack](/wiki/Sporkhack "Sporkhack"), [Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") start with a cloak of protection in place of the usual cloak of magic resistance.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the cloak of protection grants 3 AC and 3 [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") while worn, and can be safely enchanted to +7. A [dragonhide](/wiki/Dragonhide "Dragonhide") cloak of protection can be very valuable, providing 9 AC and 10 DR at +7.

[Amm Kamerel](/wiki/Amm_Kamerel "Amm Kamerel") wizard leaders will always generate with a cloak of protection.

[The Mantle of Heaven](/wiki/The_Mantle_of_Heaven "The Mantle of Heaven") and [The Vestment of Hell](/wiki/The_Vestment_of_Hell "The Vestment of Hell") are [quest artifacts](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") for the [Noble](/wiki/Noble "Noble") that each have a cloak with a randomized appearance as their [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item"), making it possible for one of them to be a cloak of protection. The Mantle of Heaven appears as an ornamental cope and is given to [human](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)") and [incantifier](/wiki/Incantifier_\(starting_race\) "Incantifier (starting race)") Nobles, while The Vestment appears as an opera cloak and is given to [vampiric](/wiki/Vampire_\(starting_race_in_dNetHack\) "Vampire (starting race in dNetHack)") Nobles.

A cloak of protection can be used to repair the ballistic base layer of [imperial elven body armor](/wiki/Imperial_elven_armor "Imperial elven armor"), conferring [half physical damage](/wiki/Half_physical_damage "Half physical damage").

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), a cloak of protection can be created at a furnace by combining a [plain cloak](/wiki/Plain_cloak "Plain cloak") and an [amulet of guarding](/wiki/Amulet_of_guarding "Amulet of guarding").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), all non-[giant](/wiki/Giant_\(starting_race\) "Giant (starting race)") [Infidels](/wiki/Infidel "Infidel") start the game with a cursed fireproof +0 cloak of protection. The [gauntlets of protection](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_protection "Gauntlets of protection") are introduced as an alternate source of MC3 that giants and [tortles](/wiki/Tortle_\(starting_race\) "Tortle (starting race)") can use.

The [Archbishop of Moloch](/wiki/Archbishop_of_Moloch "Archbishop of Moloch") has a 1⁄3 chance of generating with a cloak of protection. Player monster [infidels](/index.php?title=Infidel_\(player_monster\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Infidel (player monster) (page does not exist)") that are not [giants](/wiki/Giant_\(monster_attribute\) "Giant (monster attribute)") are very likely to generate with a cloak of protection, and the cloak is also used in several kits for level 20 player monsters (minus giants and tortles).

### SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") introduces [Blackshroud](/index.php?title=Blackshroud\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Blackshroud (page does not exist)"), a neutral artifact cloak of protection that grants [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning"), [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") and acts as a [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone") while worn. SlashTHEM also adds The Mantle of Heaven and The Vestment of Hell as Noble quest artifacts, which have a chance of their randomized appearance being a cloak of protection.

A cloak of protection is a type of magical cloak that appears in NetHack. It is made of cloth and has a randomized appearance when unidentified; the default one associated with it is a tattered cape.[1]

Generation

In addition to random generation, the cloak of protection can be sold in general shops and armor shops.

Aligned priests, high priests and the Arch Priest have a 2⁄21 chance of generating with a cloak of protection.[2]

Player monsters that are not monks, including those generated on the Astral Plane, have an effective ~14.83% chance of generating with a cloak of protection as their initial cloak before role-based replacements.[3][4] Priests have a 3⁄4 chance of forcing a robe instead, reducing their effective chance to ~3.71%, while wizards have a 1⁄2 chance of forcing a cloak of magic resistance, reducing their effective chance to ~7.42%.[5][6]

Description

When worn, a cloak of protection provides 3 points of base AC and MC3, and will auto-identify itself.

Strategy

The cloak of protection is the only single piece of armor that grants MC3 by itself, making it a strong option for characters without strong ranged attacks to defend against certain attack effects, such as the disenchanter's bite attack (but not passive disenchantment) and level drain from monsters like the various wraiths and vampires.

Players that have another source of magic resistance (usually gray dragon scale mail) and can do without a cloak of displacement may consider this cloak a viable choice for their ascension kits.

Identification

A cloak of protection is trivial to identify by wearing it once it has been curse-tested, either using a pet or an altar. In terms of price identification, both it and the cloak of displacement have a base price of 50zm.

History

The cloak of protection first appears in NetHack 3.0.0.

From this version to NetHack 3.4.3, several other pieces of armor provided MC3: the cloak of magic resistance in particular is the preferred source of MC3 for these versions, with its magic resistance providing much more value compared to the cloak of protection's +2 extra base AC - some variants based on NetHack 3.4.3 and earlier versions maintain similar MC values for cloaks and some other armor.

The cloak of protection is the only piece of armor to give MC3 as of NetHack 3.6.0 - some variants based on this and later versions may add new items as additional sources of MC3.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, upgrading a cloak of protection will produce either an oilskin cloak or elven cloak, while upgrading an oilskin cloak or elven cloak has a 1⁄4 chance of producing a cloak of protection.

SporkHack

In Sporkhack, Wizards start with a cloak of protection in place of the usual cloak of magic resistance.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, the cloak of protection grants 3 AC and 3 DR while worn, and can be safely enchanted to +7. A dragonhide cloak of protection can be very valuable, providing 9 AC and 10 DR at +7.

Amm Kamerel wizard leaders will always generate with a cloak of protection.

The Mantle of Heaven and The Vestment of Hell are quest artifacts for the Noble that each have a cloak with a randomized appearance as their base item, making it possible for one of them to be a cloak of protection. The Mantle of Heaven appears as an ornamental cope and is given to human and incantifier Nobles, while The Vestment appears as an opera cloak and is given to vampiric Nobles.

A cloak of protection can be used to repair the ballistic base layer of imperial elven body armor, conferring half physical damage.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, a cloak of protection can be created at a furnace by combining a plain cloak and an amulet of guarding.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, all non-giant Infidels start the game with a cursed fireproof +0 cloak of protection. The gauntlets of protection are introduced as an alternate source of MC3 that giants and tortles can use.

The Archbishop of Moloch has a 1⁄3 chance of generating with a cloak of protection. Player monster infidels that are not giants are very likely to generate with a cloak of protection, and the cloak is also used in several kits for level 20 player monsters (minus giants and tortles).

SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, SlashTHEM introduces Blackshroud, a neutral artifact cloak of protection that grants warning, drain resistance and acts as a luckstone while worn. SlashTHEM also adds The Mantle of Heaven and The Vestment of Hell as Noble quest artifacts, which have a chance of their randomized appearance being a cloak of protection.
